channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: I've not written book to tear anyone down - Earps
item.description: Former England goalkeeper Mary Earps tells BBC Sport she did not write her autobiography to "tear anyone down" and feels reaction to it has been "distorted".

item.title: What can you read into the Premier League table after 10 games?
item.description: With 10 games gone in the Premier League season, BBC Sport looks at what history tells us we can read into the table.

item.title: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
item.description: After every round of Premier League matches this season, Troy Deeney gives us his team of the week. Do you agree with his choices?

item.title: £160m and counting - Everton's search for their dream striker continues
item.description: Everton's 10-year search for their dream striker continues. BBC Sport looks at their ongoing woes in front of goal.

item.title: O'Neil pulls out of running for shock Wolves return
item.description: Gary O'Neil pulls out of the running to become Wolves manager after coming close to a shock return.

item.title: Gyokeres injury a 'concern' for Arsenal - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says he is "concerned" by the muscle injury Viktor Gyokeres sustained during the 2-0 win at Burnley.

item.title: Xhaka's first Sunderland goal earns draw against Everton
item.description: Granit Xhaka scores his first Sunderland goal as the Black Cats come from behind to draw with Everton and move up to fourth place in the Premier League.

item.title: England may play two games away from Wembley at Euro 2028
item.description: Euro 2028 co-hosts England face playing one group match and a possible last-16 game away from Wembley.

item.title: Will Alexander-Arnold show what Liverpool are missing on return?
item.description: Trent Alexander-Arnold returns to Liverpool for the first time since moving to Real Madrid on Tuesday, when he will discover if absence has made Anfield hearts grow fonder.

item.title: Rangers 'remain unsatisfied' after SFA referee talks
item.description: Rangers say they have "concerns about the consistency of refereeing in Scottish football" and "remain unsatisfied" with an explanation on the decision to not send off Celtic's Auston Trusty in Sunday's League Cup semi-final.

item.title: Bronze and Yamal make history in Fifpro World XI
item.description: England's Lucy Bronze is named in the Fifpro Women's World XI for the eighth straight year while Barcelona's Lamine Yamal becomes the youngest player in the Men's XI.

item.title: 'It's been overwhelming to see how some things have been distorted'
item.description: Former England goalkeeper Mary Earps tells BBC Sport's Emma Sanders that she has not written her book to "tear anyone down" and feels reaction to it has been "distorted".

item.title: 'He gets a warm welcome from me' - Slot on Alexander-Arnold
item.description: Arne Slot says he is unsure what kind of reception Trent Alexander-Arnold will receive from fans when he returns to Liverpool in the Champions League with Real Madrid on Tuesday.

item.title: 'It's easy with good players' - Le Bris praises midfield duo
item.description: Sunderland boss Regis le Bris is full of praise for midfielders Granit Xhaka and Noah Sadiki after they help his side fight back to draw 1-1 against Everton at the Stadium of Light.

item.title: Everton should have 'put game away' - Moyes
item.description: Manager David Moyes says Everton should have put the game beyond Sunderland after taking the lead, as they draw 1-1 at the Stadium of Light in the Premier League.

item.title: Kerr's 'instinctive' chip features in WSL's best goals
item.description: Sam Kerr's "instinctive" chip in Chelsea's 2-0 win over London City Lionesses features in the best goals from the weekend's WSL games.

item.title: Mainoo closer to Man Utd exit - Tuesday's gossip
item.description: Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is closer to leaving Old Trafford, Barcelona will complete a deal for Marcus Rashford if he agrees to their wage offer, Newcastle eye Atalanta midfielder Ederson, plus more.

item.title: Agent arrested after player 'threatened with gun'
item.description: A football agent is arrested after allegedly threatening a Premier League footballer with a gun.

item.title: Joey Barton 'crossed line' with offensive X posts
item.description: The ex-footballer goes on trial over social media posts about presenter Jeremy Vine and pundits Eni Aluko and Lucy Ward.

item.title: More than 700 officers to police Villa-Maccabi match
item.description: Police horses, dogs and drones will be on patrol on Thursday as protesters plan demonstrations.

item.title: Arteta wants Premier League game moved as EFL warns congestion 'unavoidable'
item.description: Mikel Arteta calls for Arsenal's Premier League match on 21 December to move after their Carabao Cup quarter-final fixture against Crystal Palace is scheduled two days later.

item.title: 'I worry about unity' - Southgate on St George's flag
item.description: Former England manager Gareth Southgate says there is "more that unites us than separates us" amid a debate about flying the St George's flag.

item.title: Van de Ven and Spence meant 'no disrespect' - Frank
item.description: Tottenham boss Thomas Frank says Micky van de Ven and Djed Spence have apologised to him after the pair snubbed the manager when leaving the pitch following defeat by Chelsea.

item.title: Two sixth-tier sides guaranteed in FA Cup third round
item.description: Two sides from the sixth tier of the English football pyramid are guaranteed to be in this season's FA Cup third round following Monday's second-round draw.

item.title: Clarke plays down Scotland keeper crisis & targets Denmark 'cup final'
item.description: Manager Steve Clarke dismisses talk of a Scotland goalkeeping crisis and eyes a "cup final" against Denmark in the World Cup qualifiers.

item.title: Who could the home nations face in 2027 World Cup qualifying?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at what awaits England, Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland in Tuesday's qualifying draw for the 2027 World Cup.

item.title: Scunthorpe player and Forest fan among train attack victims
item.description: Scunthorpe United footballer Jonathan Gjoshe, 22 and Nottingham Forest fan Stephen Crean were stabbed.

item.title: Spurs pair 'meant no disrespect' with Frank snub
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur's Thomas Frank says Micky van de Ven and Djed Spence "meant no disrespect" and apologised for snubbing the manager when leaving the pitch following defeat by Chelsea.

item.title: Should Earps' 'negative' comments on Hampton have been made public?
item.description: The Women's Football Show pundits Lindsay Johnson & Fern Whelan discuss former England goalkeeper Mary Earps's "negative" comments about Hannah Hampton and whether they should have been made publicly or not.

item.title: 'Praying I get a good reception' - Pickford's Stadium of Light return
item.description: Everton's Jordan Pickford explains what it will be like to face boyhood club Sunderland for the first time since swapping Wearside for Merseyside in 2017.

item.title: There's more that bonds us than separates us - Southgate
item.description: Sir Gareth Southgate believes England has an opportunity to "change the narrative" amid concerns the country is becoming less united, when asked about the debate about flying the St George's flag.

item.title: Haaland scores twice to send Man City second
item.description: Watch highlights as Erling Haaland scores twice for Manchester City in a 3-1 win against Bournemouth which lifts Pep Guardiola's side up to second in the Premier League.

item.title: From zero to hero - but can Osmand kick on at Celtic?
item.description: Callum Osmand experienced the best day of his life by scoring in Celtic's League Cup semi-final win over Rangers - so what's next for the teenage striker?

item.title: Why VAR won't be getting involved in corners
item.description: Nottingham Forest boss Sean Dyche is frustrated after Casemiro's goal from a corner is allowed to stand, but VAR will not be changing to include them in its remit.

item.title: Tuchel must consider calling up Welbeck - Rooney
item.description: Wayne Rooney says England manager Thomas Tuchel has to consider striker Danny Welbeck for a recall to his squad.

item.title: Edwards has 'full focus' on Middlesbrough after Wolves links
item.description: Middlesbrough boss Rob Edwards says his full focus is on Tuesday's game against Leicester, despite links with the Wolves job.

item.title: O'Neill 'lit the fuse' & fearless Rohl - fan verdict on Old Firm semi
item.description: What Celtic and Rangers fans thought the Scottish League Cup semi-final said about their new managers Martin O'Neill and Danny Rohl.

item.title: Van Dijk rejects Rooney's 'lazy criticism'
item.description: Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk says Wayne Rooney blaming a lack of leadership for the Anfield side's recent poor form is "lazy criticism".

item.title: 'He lives for the goals' - robot Haaland returns from malfunction
item.description: Erling Haaland pulled out the robot dance in the win over Bournemouth and his levels were compared to Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo by boss Pep Guardiola.

item.title: Will Football Manager help women's football grow?
item.description: The launch of the latest edition of the Football Manager series will enhance visibility of the women's game, and could help unearth some unheralded female talents too.

item.title: 'I don't even know when it is' - but will O'Neill be Celtic manager for final?
item.description: After guiding Celtic past Rangers, Martin O'Neill concedes he'd "secretly love" to lead the team in next month's final.

item.title: Why is Oxlade-Chamberlain training with Arsenal?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything explains why Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain is training with Arsenal.

item.title: 'An epic fightback' - Blundell makes Man Utd return after giving birth
item.description: Manchester United's Hannah Blundell makes her return to football after more than a year away to give birth to her daughter.

item.title: 'I almost could've taken anyone off' - Howe shared 'honest' words after defeat
item.description: Newcastle United have now failed to win an away league game since April following yet another defeat on the road against West Ham

item.title: Points, pubs and Pereira - why a perfect match at Wolves turned sour
item.description: Wolves wanted stability and consistency but the axe fell for Vitor Pereira on Sunday with the club eight points from safety.

item.title: The former England masterminds looking to build a 'superpower'
item.description: When something works successfully, it makes sense to try it again. That's what Kay Cossington and Anja van Ginhoven are doing.

item.title: Who are England playing in U17 World Cup and when?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains how the 2025 Under-17s World Cup, who is playing in it and who is involved.

item.title: Southampton sack Still after five months in charge
item.description: Southampton sack manager Will Still after just five months in charge and with the club 21st in the Championship.

item.title: What are the Premier League concussion rules?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at what the Premier League's rules are on head injuries and concussion.

item.title: Enderby taken to hospital with suspected neck injury
item.description: Liverpool forward Mia Enderby is taken to hospital with a suspected neck injury sustained in her side's defeat at Tottenham.

item.title: Rangers probe SFA for answers - but were they hard done by?
item.description: Rangers head coach Danny Rohl refuses to use controversial refereeing decisions as an excuse for his side's Premier Sports Cup semi-final defeat by Celtic, preferring to focus on their "outstanding" reaction.

item.title: Rooney defends punditry after Van Dijk criticism
item.description: Wayne Rooney defends his previous criticism of Liverpool and Virgil van Dijk after the Reds captain called the pundit's analysis of their early season struggles "'lazy".

item.title: Mukiele a 'massive coup' for Sunderland - Onuoha
item.description: Football Focus pundits Nedum Onuoha and Ellen White look at what Nordi Mukiele has brought to Sunderland at both ends of the pitch, ahead of their game with Everton on Monday.

item.title: West Ham come from behind to beat Newcastle
item.description: Watch highlights as a spirited West Ham side come from behind to record their first home win of the season against Newcastle United at the London Stadium.

item.title: 'Thunderous finish!' - Rashford scores great goal for Barcelona
item.description: Marcus Rashford scores his second goal of the season as Barcelona beat Elche 3-1 in La Liga.

item.title: Russo & Blackstenius shine as Arsenal thrash Leicester
item.description: Watch highlights as Alessia Russo and Stina Blackstenius help Arsenal thrash Leicester City to their third-consecutive win in all competitions at King Power Stadium in the Women's Super League.

item.title: Man City's high-risk plan - and why it paid off against Bournemouth
item.description: Former Manchester United midfielder Michael Carrick analyses Manchester City's plan to exploit the middle of the pitch in their 3-1 win against Bournemouth in the Premier League on Match of the Day.

item.title: Goals galore as Port Vale beat Maldon & Tiptree
item.description: Port Vale score four goals in eight minutes and a fifth in the second half to fire themselves into the second round of the FA Cup.

item.title: Does 'timeless wonder' Welbeck deserve England recall?
item.description: Danny Welbeck last played for England in 2018 but will his recent form at Brighton be enough to encourage Thomas Tuchel to select him for this month's World Cup qualifiers?

item.title: Pickford on England records, World Cup dream & love of motocross
item.description: Jordan Pickford sits down with Kelly Somers to discuss life at Everton, keeping clean sheets for England, a World Cup dream and a love of motocross.

item.title: 'From black and white football to full colour' - Emery's three years at Villa
item.description: As Unai Emery marks three years at Aston Villa, Guillem Balague looks at his journey to Villa Park and his bid to "awaken the giant".

item.title: Has England's Euros triumph given women's club football a boost?
item.description: One of the constant refrains throughout England's triumphant run at Euro 2025 – and indeed most women's football matches in recent years – has been how important the success of the Lionesses has been for the growth of the game. But what has been the impact?

item.title: Vinicius Jr no longer feels 'untouchable' - so what's going on?
item.description: Vinicius Jr no longer feels untouchable at Real Madrid and recent events are a truce, not a resolution, writes Guillem Balague.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Is Delap banned in Premier League after EFL Cup red card?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Chelsea striker Liam Delap will serve a Premier League suspension after being sent off in the EFL Cup.

item.title: Why are teams making substitutions in the first minute of matches?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why clubs in the National League Cup are making substitutions in the first minute of games

item.title: Is masked Premier League star allowed to play in Baller League?
item.description: BBC Sport explains the Premier League rules on whether a Premier League player can really feature in Baller League UK.

item.title: What is the Fifpro World XI and who are the winners?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what the Fifpro World XI is, who votes for the award and when the winners will be announced.

item.title: What does it mean when a club enters administration?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at what it means when a club enters administration.

item.title: What is the Premier League multi-ball system?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the rules of the Premier League multi-ball system and what happened in Liverpool's defeat against Manchester United.

item.title: When did a non-Old Firm team last win a Scottish title?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the last time a team other than Rangers or Celtic won Scottish football's top flight division.

item.title: Rangers 'didn't screw up' head coach appointment
item.description: Chairman Andrew Cavenagh insists Rangers did not "screw up" the process to appoint head coach Danny Rohl but admits it looked "clunky" from the outside.

item.title: What did we learn from Rohl's Rangers unveiling?
item.description: Danny Rohl understands the need to win quickly as Rangers head coach and says he can handle pressure, as chief executive Patrick Stewart and sporting director Kevin Thelwell come under fire.

item.title: Winning & togetherness - Rohl sets out Rangers mission
item.description: Danny Rohl delivers a simple message as he is introduced as Rangers head coach, stating: "We want to win."

item.title: 'Rohl jumps from Wednesday frying pan into Rangers furnace'
item.description: Danny Rohl has taken on one of the toughest managerial jobs in world football by succeeding Russell Martin at Rangers, writes Tom English.

item.title: 'A proud club dragged into gutter'
item.description: Kevin Muscat is the latest to be ruled out of Rangers' manager search - so what do fans make of the process, and who do they want now?

item.title: Man dies after wheelchair collides with car driven by Inter keeper
item.description: A man dies after his electric wheelchair collides with a car driven by Inter Milan goalkeeper Josep Martinez.

item.title: Pedri hamstring tear adds to Barcelona injury woes
item.description: Barcelona and Spain midfielder Pedri will be sidelined for the foreseeable future after suffering a tear in his hamstring.

item.title: Vinicius Jr 'didn't want to offend' in Clasico clash
item.description: Real Madrid's Vinicius Jr says he "didn't want to offend anyone" when he and some of his team-mates clashed with Barcelona players after winning Sunday's El Clasico.

item.title: De Bruyne has surgery after penalty thigh injury
item.description: Napoli midfielder Kevin de Bruyne is set for a lengthy spell on the sidelines after undergoing surgery on the thigh injury he sustained while scoring a penalty against Inter Milan.

item.title: Juventus sack manager Tudor after seven months
item.description: Juventus sack head coach Igor Tudor with the side eighth in Serie A after weekend defeat by Lazio.

item.title: Real Madrid impress but Vinicius tension grows - Clasico talking points
item.description: Spanish football expert Guillem Balague analyses a fiery Clasico at the Bernabeu, which saw Real Madrid beat Barcelona but Vinicius Jr vent his frustration.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
